name: Birds of a Feather Feeding Together
description: This captured observation, "Birds of a Feather Feeding Together" gives new meaning to the mid-16th century proverb, "Birds of a feather flock together". Benjamin Jowett, a British classical scholar, and a translator of Plato cited the phrase in his 1856 translation of Plato's Republic with the phrase... "Men of my age flock together; we are birds of a feather...". Over the years, ornithologists (zoologists who study the science of birds) have studied and documented the behavior of "birds of a single species flying together than flocking together". Here, the birds of interest are feeding together.   🐦 Full Disclosure: It must be noted that No birds, habitat, or any other living creatures were disturbed during the recording of this observation. 🐦 Please note: Buyer(s) have the right to own, sell, lend, or otherwise transfer the NFT itself.
